Since the Bible says that in the beginning God created the Heaven and the Earth, can we assume that Heaven is part of the material universe? If it is then there is gravity. Hell is not a place; it is a one-time event that will take place on this Earth at the end of the millenium. The gravity will be whatever it is on the Earth.

The way heaven and hell were described to me (by people who claim to know these things) is that heaven and hell are not places you go to like another planet or country. In both, you exist as a disembodied entity, or soul. No body, no senses, none of that stuff. In heaven your soul is in the presence of God and bathes in his radiant love for eternity. Nothing more than that, what more could any Christian want? Hell is the same, but there you soul is tormented by pain, fear and madness for eternity. That is the worst part. You will know with utter certainty that you can never escape. Not sure I would like either option.

In the Baha’i Faith “heaven and hell” are not in the physical universe, rather they are a spiritual condition of the soul as being near or distant from God. So the concept of gravity doesn’t apply: The Bahá’í teachings state that there is no such physical place as heaven or hell, and emphasise the eternal journey of the soul towards perfection. They explain that references to “heaven” and “hell” in the Holy Scriptures of other religions are to be understood symbolically, describing states of nearness to and distance from God in this world and in the realms beyond. ‘Abdu’l-Bahá has said that when human beings “become illuminated with the radiance of the sun of reality, and ennobled with all the virtues, they esteem this the greatest reward, and they know it to be the true paradise. In the same way they consider that the spiritual punishment…is to be subjected to the world of nature; to be veiled from God; to be brutal and ignorant; to fall into carnal lusts; to be absorbed in animal frailties; to be characterized with dark qualities…these are the greatest punishments and tortures…”1 What Bahá’ís Believe

Who are you asking, and how do you expect them to know? Nobody has any more access to genuine information about heaven and hell than you do, including whether or not they even exist. But gravity only affects mass. We are told that heaven and hell and their occupants are non-physical and hence massless, so if that’s true it would have no effect there whether it operated or not.

No, and hell doesn’t even exist. There is only heaven, which I prefer calling the afterlife. The afterlife is a different dimension, all made from energy. It’s not a physical place. There are no atoms and molecules. There is no matter, no mass, and therefore, no gravity. Souls reside in the afterlife, and are no more physical than the afterlife.
